meanings.sent1: She swounded when she saw the spider.
meanings.sent2: He swounded after hearing the shocking news.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly dance made her swounded with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset swounded her senses.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell of the flowers swounded her in the garden.

meanings.definition: Past tense of 'swound', meaning to wound or injure.
meanings.sent1: The warrior swounded his enemy in battle.
meanings.sent2: The accident swounded the driver, leaving him in pain.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally swounded the cake with too much salt.
meanings.sent4: His words swounded her heart more than any physical injury could.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal swounded his trust in people.
